intro: Cyathula repens, commonly known as the creeping cyathula, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has alternate, ovate leaves with smooth margins. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in cyathia, which are cup-like structures characteristic of the genus. Cyathula repens is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in humid conditions.
